title: 115_hr462
content: The Act may be cited as the "Reforming Executive Guidance Act of 2017" or the "REG Act of 2017." It involves congressional review of agency rulemaking. The term 'rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to exclude certain rules, such as those of particular applicability or relating to agency management or personnel. The term 'major rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, is defined as any rule that has a significant impact on the economy, resulting in an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, or a major increase in costs or prices. The term 'major rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, is defined as any rule that has a significant impact on the economy, resulting in an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, or a major increase in costs or prices for consumers, industries, government agencies, or regions. It also includes adverse effects on competition, employment, investment, productivity, innovation, and the ability of US-based enterprises to compete globally. The term excludes rules under the Telecommunications Act of 1996. The term 'guidance document' is defined as a statement issued by a Federal agency that sets policy or interpretation on a statutory, regulatory, or technical issue. A 'significant guidance document' is one that may lead to an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, or adversely affect the economy, productivity, competition, or employment. The term 'guidance document' refers to a statement issued by a Federal agency that sets policy or interpretation on a statutory, regulatory, or technical issue. It excludes any guidance document that may create inconsistencies with actions taken by another Federal agency, alter budgetary impacts, or raise novel legal or policy issues. The term 'guidance document' excludes regulations pertaining to military or foreign affairs, organization, management, or personnel matters of a Federal agency, and certain categories exempted by the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs. SEC. 3. Amends the definition of "rule" in title 5, United States Code, to include significant guidance for rulemaking.
